page.title: 16LANDSCAPES
page.content: Birtley town centre is situated along the flat bottom of a valley its good communications have led to quite heavy industrialisation, which in turn has led to the growth of Birtley from a rural village into an urban town expanding up the east side of the valley. To the west of the valley, much of the rural area remains and arable farming with traditional hedgerow enclosed fields predominate. The buildings in the older central part of the town consist mainly of brick terraced housing and small family shops, although recently modern supermarkets have begun to open. They remain few in number however. The larger buildings of past importance are built from stone blocks. On the frings are link villas, bungalows & semi-detached houses predominate.
